Wisdom: الْمُرُوءَةُ إِنْجَازُ الْوَعْدِ
enWisdom: Magnanimity is fulfilling one’s promise

Wisdom: الْمُرُوءَةُ اجْتِنَابُ الدَّنِيَّةِ
enWisdom: Magnanimity is eschewing vile traits

Wisdom: إِخْفَاءُ الْفَاقَةِ وَالْأَمْرَاضِ مِنَ الْمُرُوءَةِ
enWisdom: Concealing [one’s] poverty and sickness is part of magnanimity

Wisdom: الْمُرُوءَةُ تَحُثُّ عَلَى الْمَكَارِمِ
enWisdom: Magnanimity impels [one] towards noble traits

Wisdom: الْمُرُوءَةُ مِنْ كُلِّ لُؤْمٍ بَرِيَّةٌ
enWisdom: Magnanimity is being free from every [form of] wickedness

Wisdom: الْمُرُوءَةُ تَمْنَعُ مِنْ كُلِّ دَنِيَّةٍ
enWisdom: Magnanimity prevents every vileness

Wisdom: الْمُرُوءَةُ بَرِيَّةٌ مِنَ الْخَنَى [الْخِيَانَةِ] وَالْغَدْرِ
enWisdom: Magnanimity is being free from vulgarity and disloyalty

Wisdom: الْمُرُوءَةُ اجْتِنَابُ الرَّجُلِ مَا يَشِينُهُ وَاكْتِسَابُهُ مَا يَزِينُهُ [بزينة]
enWisdom: Magnanimity is a person’s eschewal of that which dishonours him and his earning that which embellishes him

Wisdom: الْمُرُوءَةُ الْعَدْلُ فِي الْإِمْرَةِ وَالْعَفْوُ مَعَ الْقُدْرَةِ وَالْمُوَاسَاةُ فِي الْعِشْرَةِ [الْعُسْرَةِ]
enWisdom: Magnanimity is [displaying] equity when in authority, showing forgiveness despite having the power [to take revenge] and being financially supportive [to those in need] in one’s society (or in times of hardship)

Wisdom: الْمُرُوءَةُ بَثُّ الْمَعْرُوفِ وَقِرَى الضُّيُوفِ
enWisdom: Magnanimity is spreading goodness and being hospitable to guests

Wisdom: أَوَّلُ الْمُرُوءَةِ طَاعَةُ اللَّهِ وَآخِرُهَا التَّنَزُّهُ عَنِ الدَّنَايَا
enWisdom: The beginning of magnanimity is obedience to Allah and its end is keeping away from vile traits

Wisdom: أَوَّلُ الْمُرُوءَةِ طَلَاقَةُ الْوَجْهِ وَآخِرُهَا التَّوَدُّدُ إِلَى النَّاسِ
enWisdom: The beginning of magnanimity is [having] a cheerful mien and its end is being affectionate towards the people

Wisdom: أَوَّلُ الْمُرُوءَةِ الْبِشْرُ وَآخِرُهَا اسْتِدَامَةُ الْبِرِّ
enWisdom: The beginning of magnanimity is cheerfulness and its end is persistence in righteousness

Wisdom: أَشْرَفُ الْمُرُوءَةِ حُسْنُ الْأُخُوَّةِ
enWisdom: The most honourable magnanimity is loyal brotherhood

Wisdom: أَحْسَنُ الْمُرُوءَةِ حِفْظُ الْوُدِّ
enWisdom: The best magnanimity is preserving goodwill [and affection]

Wisdom: أَشْرَفُ الْمُرُوءَةِ مِلْكُ الْغَضَبِ وَإِمَاتَةُ الشَّهْوَةِ
enWisdom: The most honourable magnanimity is controlling one’s anger and killing one’s lustful desires

Wisdom: أَفْضَلُ الْمُرُوءَةِ احْتِمَالُ جِنَايَاتِ الْإِخْوَانِ
enWisdom: The most excellent magnanimity is tolerating the offenses of one’s brothers

Wisdom: أَفْضَلُ الْمُرُوءَةِ اسْتِقْبَالُ [اسْتِبْقَاءُ] الرَّجُلِ مَاءَ وَجْهِهِ
enWisdom: The most excellent magnanimity is for a man to preserve his dignity

Wisdom: أَفْضَلُ [أَصْلُ‏] الْمُرُوءَةِ الْحَيَاءُ وَثَمَرَتُهُ الْعِفَّةُ
enWisdom: The most excellent magnanimity is modesty, and its fruit is chastity

Wisdom: أَصْلُ الْمُرُوءَةِ الْحَيَاءُ وَثَمَرَتُهَا الْعِفَّةُ
enWisdom: The root of magnanimity is modesty and its fruit is chastity

Wisdom: أَفْضَلُ الْمُرُوءَةِ مُوَاسَاةُ الْإِخْوَانِ بِالْأَمْوَالِ وَمُسَاوَاتُهُمْ فِي الْأَحْوَالِ
enWisdom: The most excellent magnanimity is financially supporting your brothers with [your] wealth, and treating them as your equals in status

Wisdom: لَا مُرُوَّةَ كَالتَّنَزُّهِ عَنِ الْمَآثِمِ
enWisdom: There is no magnanimity like remaining free from sins

Wisdom: ثَلَاثٌ فِيهِنَّ الْمُرُوءَةُ غَضُّ الطَّرْفِ وَغَضُّ الصَّوْتِ وَمَشْيُ الْقَصْدِ
enWisdom: There is magnanimity in three things: lowering one’s gaze, lowering one’s voice and walking with modesty

Wisdom: ثَلَاثٌ هُنَّ جِمَاعُ الْمُرُوءَةِ عَطَاءٌ مِنْ غَيْرِ مَسْأَلَةٍ وَوَفَاءٌ مِنْ غَيْرِ عَهْدٍ وَجُودٌ مَعَ إِقْلَالٍ
enWisdom: Three things are the consolidators of magnanimity: Giving without being asked, being faithful without having made a promise and being generous despite having less

Wisdom: ثَلَاثٌ هُنَّ الْمُرُوءَةُ جُودٌ مَعَ قِلَّةٍ وَاحْتِمَالٌ مِنْ غَيْرِ مَذَلَّةٍ وَتَعَفُّفٌ عَنِ الْمَسْأَلَةِ
enWisdom: Three things amount to magnanimity: generosity despite poverty [and hardship], tolerance of everything other than humiliation and refraining from asking others

Wisdom: جِمَاعُ الْمُرُوءَةِ أَنْ لَا تَعْمَلَ فِي السِّرِّ مَا تَسْتَحْيِي مِنْهُ فِي الْعَلَانِيَةِ
enWisdom: The completeness of magnanimity is for you not to do in private what you would feel ashamed of doing in front of others

Wisdom: خَصْلَتَانِ فِيهِمَا جِمَاعُ الْمُرُوءَةِ اجْتِنَابُ الرَّجُلِ مَا يَشِينُهُ وَاكْتِسَابُهُ مَا يَزِينُهُ
enWisdom: Two qualities have in them the consolidation of magnanimity: a person’s eschewing that which disgraces him and his acquiring that which embellishes him

Wisdom: صِدْقُ الرَّجُلِ عَلَى قَدْرِ مُرُوءَتِهِ
enWisdom: The truthfulness of a man is to the extent of his magnanimity

Wisdom: عَلَى قَدْرِ الْمُرُوَّةِ تَكُونُ السَّخَاوَةُ
enWisdom: One’s generosity is proportionate to one’s magnanimity

Wisdom: لَيْسَ لِمَلُولٍ مُرُوَّةٌ
enWisdom: One who is fed-up has no magnanimity

Wisdom: لَمْ يَتَّصِفْ بِالْمُرُوَّةِ مَنْ لَمْ يَرْعَ ذِمَّةَ أَوْلِيَائِهِ وَيُنْصِفْ أَعْدَاءَهُ
enWisdom: He who is not careful of his obligation towards his friends and does not treat his enemies justly cannot be attributed with magnanimity

Wisdom: مَنْ لَا مُرُوَّةَ لَهُ لَا هِمَّةَ لَهُ
enWisdom: NULL

Wisdom: مَنْ صَبَرَ عَلَى شَهْوَتِهِ تَنَاهَى فِي الْمُرُوَّةِ
enWisdom: One who is patient in the face of his lust becomes complete in [his] magnanimity

Wisdom: مِنْ شَرَائِطِ الْمُرُوَّةِ التَّنَزُّهُ عَنِ الْحَرَامِ
enWisdom: Keeping away from the forbidden is one of the conditions of magnanimity

Wisdom: مِنْ تَمَامِ الْمُرُوَّةِ التَّنَزُّهُ عَنِ الدَّنِيَّةِ
enWisdom: Staying clear of vile traits is from the completeness of magnanimity

Wisdom: مِنْ تَمَامِ الْمُرُوَّةِ أَنْ تَنْسَى الْحَقَّ لَكَ وَتَذْكُرَ الْحَقَّ عَلَيْكَ
enWisdom: It is from the completeness of magnanimity for you to forget your right upon others while recalling their right upon you

Wisdom: مُبَايَنَةُ الْعَوَامِّ مِنْ أَفْضَلِ الْمُرُوَّةِ
enWisdom: Separating yourself from the masses is from the best magnanimity

Wisdom: مِلَاكُ الْمُرُوَّةِ صِدْقُ اللِّسَانِ وَبَذْلُ الْإِحْسَانِ
enWisdom: The basis of magnanimity is truthful speech and doing good to others

Wisdom: لَا تَكْمُلُ الْمُرُوَّةُ إِلَّا بِاحْتِمَالِ جِنَايَاتِ الْمَعْرُوفِ
enWisdom: Magnanimity is not completed except by bearing the hardships of good acts

Wisdom: يُسْتَدَلُّ عَلَى الْمُرُوَّةِ بِكَثْرَةِ الْحَيَاءِ وَبَذْلِ النَّدَى وَكَفِّ الْأَذَى
enWisdom: Magnanimity is evinced by increased modesty, generous giving and refraining from harming others
